name: An Indonesian Girl: Tari Pendet and Barong from Bali
description:
Tari Pendet is a dance usually performed before religious ceremonies in Bali, and Tari Barong is about a supernatural animal (the Barong) protecting humans from evil spirit such as Rangda, the queen of the leaks (demons).

During cultural events or performances, sometimes they are performed together. This time the Barong is chasing the leak through the rice terraces of Tegallalang, Ubud. The music is performed by Balinese gamelan performers.

Indonesia is an archipelago of over 17000 islands. There are many tribes, with their own individual dances and costumes, spread along these islands. I want to share with you the dances of my family heritage and of places I live.
